Name: G_Biz_1
Question: How much can a small business be awarded?
Answer: Grant awards can be up to $25,000.

Name: G_Biz_2
Question: What is the purpose of this grant?
Answer: This grant aims to help small businesses and microenterprises with losses they have experienced due to COVID-19.

Name: G_Biz_3
Question: What businesses are eligible for this grant?
Answer:
• Must have a business with a physical establishment located in Newark.
  • Must have twenty five (25) employees or less.
  • Must have been in operation for at one year.
  • Must have experienced a direct loss of income due to COVID-19.
  • Have committed NO violations of the City of Newark COVID-19 shutdown guidelines.
  • Have NOT been awarded a grant from the City of Newark during previous rounds.
  • Have NO threatening or pending litigation or material contingent obligation against applicant.

If one or more of the above listed is not met, the business will not be eligible for this grant.

Name: G_Biz_4
Question: What expenses does the grant award cover?
Answer: Grant awards cover accounts payable, payroll, inventory, licensing and license renewal, utilities, accounting and auditing services, rent, insurance, COVID-related equipment and supplies for adaptation and recovery.

Name: G_Biz_5
Question: What period of time does the grant cover?
Answer: Grant awards cover losses experienced during the COVID-19 pandemic, dating back to March 2020.

Name: G_Biz_6
Question: What is the funding source for this grant?
Answer: This $2 million grant is funded by US Department of Housing and Urban Development Community Development Grant (CDBG) funds.

Name: G_Biz_7
Question: Who is administering this grant?
Answer: This grant program is administered by the City of Newark, Department of Economic and Housing Development.

Name: G_Biz_8
Question: When can applicants apply?
Answer: The online application opens December 17 at 2pm and closes on December 31 at 5pm.

Name: G_Biz_9
Question: Where can applicants apply?
Answer: Eligible Newark small businesses can apply by visiting NewarkCOVID19.com

Name: G_Biz_10
Question: How do applicants apply?
Answer: Eligible Newark small businesses can apply by completing the online application and uploading all required documents at the end of the application. No applications can be submitted in-person.

Name: G_Biz_11
Question: What will applicants need to provide to complete an application?
Answer:
Eligible Newark small businesses will need to provide the following supporting documentation:

  • Corporate registration(s) and/or license(s).
  • Proof of general liability insurance as required for the size and scale of the business.
  • Most recent year's corporate and owner's personal federal and state tax returns OR internal business financials (profit and loss/balance sheet).
  • Payroll/employee information
  • Evidence of hardship/losses due to COVID-19 related business disruption (i.e. aging accounts payables, outstanding obligations, etc.).
  • A detailed statement or budget indicating how funds will be used.
  • A COVID-19 adaptation and recovery plan for the next 1 to 3 years. Can include outdoor structures, e-commerce, applications fees, PPE, digital literacy training, enabling remote working, diversifying products/customers/suppliers, reducing costs, securing mentors, safety protocols, marketing strategy, occupancy limits, and outdoor usage, etc. (Limited to one-page)

Required documentation (whole document) can either be scanned using a scanner or photographed using a mobile phone or device and uploaded to the online application. Clear, legible document images must be uploaded.

Name: G_Biz_12
Question: How will awardees be selected?
Answer:
Awardees will be selected by a committee guided by the above criteria and scoring will be weighted based on:

  • Proven need
  • Newark residents employed
  • Type of business, preference to personal services
  • Location; Newark small businesses eligible everywhere, but 25% of grant funds awarded to hot spot zip codes (07104, 07105, and 07107)
  • Owners and/or employees with annual income below:

Name: G_Biz_13
Question: What is the grant award timeline?
Answer: The application closes on December 31 at 5pm. Applications will be scored throughout the month of January 2021. Grant awards will be made in February 2021.

Name: G_Biz_14
Question: How will applicants be notified?
Answer: Applicants will be notified by email as to whether a grant will be awarded.

Name: G_Biz_15
Question: Who can prospective applicants contact with questions or if assistance is needed?
Answer:
The City of Newark Economic and Housing Development Dept. can be reached for questions about how to allow at EHD@ci.newark.nj.us with the subject line “SBAGrant” and your business name. Someone will reply to you as soon as possible.

Invest Newark is partnering with the City of Newark to provide technical assistance for businesses. Invest Newark can also provide assistance with completing the application in Portuguese and Spanish. Please send email inquiries to capitalconsulting@investnewark.org with the subject line “SBAGrant” and your business name. Someone will reply to you as soon as possible.
